quote: Baseball is ninety percent mental. The other half is physical.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Love is the most important thing in the world, but baseball is pretty good, too.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Slump? I'm not in a slump. I'm just not hitting.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: If the people don't wanna come out to the ballpark, nobody's gonna stop 'em.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Fans don't boo nobodies.
author: Reggie Jackson

quote: If my uniform doesn't get dirty, I haven't done anything in the baseball game.
author: Rickey Henderson

quote: People ask me what I do in the winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.
author: Rogers Hornsby

quote: When you start the game, they don't say 'Work Ball!' They say, 'Play ball!
author: Willie Stargell

quote: I never smile when I have a bat in my hands. That's when you've got to be serious.
author: Hank Aaron

quote: Nothing's ever been as fun as baseball.
author: Mickey Mantle

quote: The way to make coaches think you're in shape in the spring is to get a tan.
author: Whitey Ford

quote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
author: Jackie Robinson

quote: I never had a job. I just always played baseball.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: Remember these two things: play hard and have fun.
author: Tony Gwynn

quote: You could be a kid for as long as you want when you play baseball.
author: Cal Ripken Jr.

quote: If you're going to play at all, you're out to win. Baseball, board games, Jeopardy, I hate to lose.
author: Derek Jeter

quote: Baseball is the only field of endeavor where a man can succeed three times out of ten and be considered a good performer.
author: Ted Williams

quote: Close doesn't count in baseball. Close only counts in horseshoes and grenades.
author: Frank Robinson

quote: Never save a pitcher for tomorrow. Tomorrow it may rain.
author: Leo Durocher

quote: I've come to the conclusion that the two most important things in life are good friends and a good bullpen.
author: Bob Lemon

quote: How can you not be romantic about baseball?
author: Billy Beane (Moneyball, 2011)

quote: Never allow the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game!
author: Babe Ruth

quote: No matter how good you are, you’re going to lose one-third of your games. No matter how bad you are you’re going to win one-third of your games. It’s the other third that makes the difference.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: A man has to have goals – for a day, for a lifetime – and that was mine, to have people say, ‘There goes Ted Williams, the greatest hitter who ever lived.'
author: Ted Willams

quote: Eighty-five percent of the f---in’ world is working, the other fifteen come out here.
author: Lee Elia, on Wrigley fans

quote: This is gonna be a tough play. Bryant... The Cubs... Win the World Series! Bryant makes the play! It's over! And the Cubs have finally won it all!
author: Joe Buck

quote: Let's play two!
author: Ernie Banks

quote: Someday the Chicago Cubs are going to be in the World Series.
author: Harry Caray
